page.title: 02RIDING FOR THE DISABLED ASS.
page.content: {Barnard's Farm}has been a riding school for 11 years.The farm covers 16 acres,all of which is grassland.There are various stable blocks and barns. There are approximately 15 horses on the farm at any one time.They have a very hard life in the{Riding School and each horse has a limited working life.When the horses are too old to work they are sold.The horses are not bred on the farm and new stock is bought in when necessary.There is one part time worker on the farm who helps with the{Riding School.}Mentally disabled people come three times a week.Adults come from{Orford House}in Ugley and children from a special school in{Bocking. The{R.D.A.}runs fund raising activities to pay for the hire of horses and relies on volunteers to help in the arena.
